ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: It is a course designed to help give us the time to work on a substantive article project during the second year. I would absolutely recommend it.

As I understand it, Research and Writing stands and falls with the instructors and the group of students. I would definitely recommend taking research and writing with Ken Scheve, with a strong group of students, and if one has a good idea of a paper topic.
solid course to work on your independent research skills. Little outside structure, you have to be your own boss, but its great to see if you can be an independent researcher.
Hard to know as bulk of it is next semester.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: Helpful to think through questions of publication, research design, research questions, etc. Very helpful course.
It was very helpful in terms of getting us professionally acclimatized to publishing aspect of the profession.
- insights into the publication process and what makes a good paper- time to focus on one paper- guided step-by-step approach to writing and publishing a paper- very good mentorship

Helped very much in terms of learning what is involved in producing god quality research papers. Also piqued my interest in topics related to my paper topic that could be potential dissertation topics.
taught me what it will be like to research on your own time and be my own boss.
